plugins.name: Vitality AI
plugins.description:
WE'RE EXCITED TO SAY THAT WE'VE RELEASED A NEW VERSION OF THIS PLUGIN, CHECK HERE, AND THIS VERSION IS NO LONGER AVAILABLE.


Introducing Vitality AI – a Figma plugin revolutionizing design creation! Generate stunning designs effortlessly with just a prompt description. From accordions to sliders, Vitality AI crafts various components to meet your design needs.


Using Vitality AI is a breeze. Simply run the plugin, wait for it to load, then describe your design and click generate. Avoid clicking elsewhere to prevent interference during the design process. Once generated, import your design into Figma with the click of a button. Need inspiration? Hit the randomize button for fresh prompts. Plus, customize import locations using the x and y coordinates.


Note: To use the plugin, users need to create a free Vitality AI account here.


Encounter an error? No worries! The plugin will notify you, or simply restart for a seamless experience. With Vitality AI, design innovation is at your fingertips.


Vitality AI includes the following components:

  1. Accordion
  2. Alert
  3. Avatar
  4. Badge
  5. Button
  6. Calendar NEW
  7. Card
  8. Checkbox
  9. Input
  10. Label
  11. Progress
  12. Radio group
  13. Select
  14. Separator
  15. Skeleton
  16. Slider
  17. Switch
  18. Tabs
  19. Textarea
plugins.tagline: Experience the Future of Design

plugins.name: Figarc - Calculate physical spaces
plugins.description:
If you are like me, and you like to “misuse” Figma by drawing floor plans, then this plugin might be helpful to you.


The Figarc plugin helps you calculate physical spaces in Imperial (cm) and Metric (inch) systems, so you can get a sense how big the spaces you are drawing are.


To make the most out of the plugin, don‘t forget to download the Figarc library, which will help you conceptualize floor plans inside Figma, and then use this plugin to measure the rooms you‘ll be designing.


**Instructions**

To measure a rectangle, select any layer or frame inside Figma and then click on “Calculate area”. Don‘t forget that yo can modify the measurement units (cm or inch) in the Settings tab.

accepted.name: Aleksandar Tasevski
accepted.description: Product Developer | 300k+ Users

accepted.name: Zlatko Najdenovski
accepted.description: Creating side projects to increase passive income before the apocalypse.

plugins.name: Micro
plugins.description:
Enhance your Figma designs with AI-driven microcopy alternatives using Micro, a plugin designed specifically for short passages of text. Perfect for all projects where great microcopy is essential.

  2. Save time refining microcopy, generate multiple high-quality options with just a click
  3. Customizable, define how many suggestions you'd like to see
  4. Micro's suggestions provide a starting point for team discussions and feedback


Note: Micro require an API Key from OpenAI to operate.


-> Microcopy.app

plugins.name: Figma i18n Plugin
plugins.description:
figma-i18n-plugin

  • 국제화를 위한 Figma 플러그인
  • Figma plugin for i18n
  • 国際化のためのFigmaプラグイン

KO

  • Global Language 관리: figma page에서 사용할 언어를 추가/삭제/변경한다.
  • Apply all: 선택한 언어로 전체 Text를 변경한다.
  • Node ID: 선택한 node의 ID를 조회한다.
  • 선택한 Node의 언어를 변경할 수 있다.
  • JSON 파일로 i18n 파일을 내보내기 할 수 있다.
  • 내보내기 한 JSON파일을 import하여 i18n 적용할 수 있다.

EN

  • Global Language Management: Add/delete/change the language to be used in the figma page.
  • Apply all: Change the entire Text to the selected language.
  • Node ID: queries the ID of the selected node.
  • You can change the language of the selected node.
  • You can export i18n files to JSON files.
  • The exported JSON file can be imported and i18n applied.


본 플러그인의 로고 및 커버 이미지는 대한민국 공군의 공군 픽토그램을 이용하였으며 공내디(https://afplay2.tistory.com/)에서 무료로 다운받으실 수 있습니다. The logo and cover images of this plug-in are used by the Air Force Pictogram of the Republic of Korea Air Force and can be downloaded free from Gongnaedi (https://afplay2.tistory.com/).

plugins.name: Design QA: Identify, Annotate and Track
plugins.description:
Identify and annotate bugs for your Design QA using our custom annotations, and track all the bugs in one place with our bug tracker table. Save time and effort while keeping track of your raised bugs in a single location.


How to Use:

  1. Create a frame or rectangle over the section of the screenshot or Figma design you wish to annotate.
  2. Keep the frame or rectangle selected.
  3. Run the plugin.
  4. Enter necessary information such as the page name where the bug was found, component, details of the discrepancy, expected behaviour, and direction for the annotation.
  5. You have multiple options:
  6. Choose between Design QA mode or Annotation mode. Note: Annotation mode does not create the QA tracker.
  7. In Design QA mode, you can choose to create a new table when starting a new QA round.
  8. You can opt to mark spacing that creates an arrow on the selected direction of the frame instead of creating an outline

Click 'Generate' and let the plugin do the work!


Tracking and Collaboration:

  1. Keep track of all bugs in the bug tracking table and share it with your engineering team for a comprehensive list of issues.


Note:

  1. Initial Use: The first time you run the plugin in Design QA mode, a tracker and status component is created. Subsequent annotations will add entries to this tracker. For annotation mode, a global counter is created. Please don't delete this node. We're using this node to keep track of number of bugs raised.
  2. Manual Adjustments: Some details, such as the points of contact for the project, design links, and browser details used during QA, will need to be manually updated.
  3. Edit with Ease: Undo and redo changes using standard cmd+z and cmd+shift+z. Ensure that entries in the tracker and annotations remain consistent. This might need multiple cmd+zs to bring it to a previous state.


We are committed to enhancing this tool to make it the ultimate companion for Design QA, continually adding features to simplify the QA process for designers. Please feel free to reach out for issues, suggestions and/or feature requests.

accepted.name: Headout Inc.
accepted.description: Creating innovative plugins and resources for the Figma community. Follow us for tools, insights, and design inspiration!

accepted.name: Mukul Chaturvedi
accepted.description: I am a Self-taught designer passionately in love with anything and everything related to designing.

plugins.tagline: Simplify design QAs with auto annotations and bug tracking

plugins.name: Groupify
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to group and align variants within your components and finely adjust the distances between groups.


-----


Instructions:

  1. Select the component with multiple variants and properties you want to orginize.
  2. After starting the plugin, you will see a list of all the properties of the component with their values. For each property, you can customize the appearance of variants.


Grouping

You can group variants by property into columns or rows.


Order of rows/columns

To change the order of rows or columns, drag the corresponding property values.


Paddings

You can customize the padding within all four sides.


Video instruction here.
plugins.tagline: A plugin that groups and aligns variants in components and adjusts distances between them

plugins.name: Frontio by NextUI
plugins.description:
Allows seamless management of Design Tokens across your design system. Define and apply tokens like border radii, spacers, colors, and typography styles consistently throughout your projects. Any changes are instantly reflected in your design, ensuring uniformity.


Key Features:


- Token Management: Create and update tokens via UI or on Frontio platform import. Manage styles based on tokens, with support for referencing and advanced design scenarios.

- AI-Powered Updates: Update tokens using AI on Frontio.ai and sync changes to local variables through the plugin.

- Supported Tokens: colors, spacing, sizing, dimensions, opacity, typography and borders.

- Advanced Referencing: Link tokens to create dynamic relationships.


Note: 🚨 Modes are currently not supported.
plugins.tagline: Design systems made easy - Frontio plugin for Figma

plugins.name: Select Random Layers
plugins.description:
Quick action to select a random subset of your current selection.


Note: If you only have only one layer selected, and that layer has children, running this action will select from the children.


Specify a Percentage of Total

Pressing Tab rather than Enter lets you input a percentage which then selects that proportion of the currently selected items. For instance, if 100 circles are selected, and you choose 'Select Random Layers > 40%', it will randomly keep 40 circles from your original selection.


Icon inspired by Yuan Qing Lim and his collection of utility plugins.


GitHub Repo

87005.description:
Quick action to select a random subset of your current selection.


Note: If you only have only one layer selected, and that layer has children, running this action will select from the children.


Specify a Percentage of Total

Pressing Tab rather than Enter lets you input a percentage which then selects that proportion of the currently selected items. For instance, if 100 circles are selected, and you choose 'Select Random Layers > 40%', it will randomly keep 40 circles from your original selection.


Icon inspired by Yuan Qing Lim and his collection of utility plugins.


GitHub Repo

parameters.description: Select a random percentage (1-99%) of current selection

87005.release_notes: Converted this command to not require a parameter. Parameter is still optional using Tab.
87005.tagline: Select a random subset of your currently selected layers

plugins.name: uibowl
plugins.description:
유아이볼의 이미지를 피그마로 더욱 간편하게 가져오세요!

*피그마 데스크탑 앱에서만 사용 가능합니다.

유아이볼 링크 : https://uibowl.io/


[이용방법]

'uibowl 웹사이트'에서

1. 원하는 이미지에 마우스를 호버해 체크박스를 선택하세요.

2. 하단에 나타나는 ‘내보내기’ 버튼을 통해 이미지를 피그마로 내보내세요.


'피그마'로 이동해서

1. 플러그인을 실행해 ‘플러그인 창’을 클릭해주세요.

2. ⌘ V를 눌러주시면 불러오기 완료!


-

Export Uibowl’s reference images into Figma with ease!

*Only available in the Figma desktop app.


On the uibowll website:

1. Hover over the desired image and select the checkbox.

2. Use the "Export" button at the bottom to send the images to Figma.


In Figma:

1. Launch the plugin and click the "Plugin Window."

2. Press ⌘ V to complete the import!


Get your references directly from Uibowl now!
plugins.tagline: Export uibowl's UI reference images into Figma

plugins.name: Work in progress
plugins.description:
The plugin quickly marks layouts which are in work or don’t approved finally. Actual for working in a large design team.


Instruction:

1. Select one or more elements (frames or components).

2. Run the plugin.

3. If the element has an overlay with the name WIP — it will be deleted.

4. If there is no layer with the name WIP, then the plugin will add it.


P.S. Use hot keys, this speed up the workflow.


Mac os:

1. Open «System Settings»

2. Open «Keyboard» and choose «Keyboard Shortcuts...»

3. In the sidebar menu —> «App Shortcuts»

4. Click [+] and choose «Figma» in dropdown. Write the plugin name «Work in progress» in menu title. Add shortcut combination.

plugins.name: Auto Size Text - AutoFit
plugins.description:
AutoFit Text is a plugin that automatically resizes text to perfectly fit its container. Designed to save time and enhance design consistency, this tool is perfect for various applications, including media localization, where different languages often result in varying text lengths. With AutoFit Text, you no longer need to manually adjust text sizes, ensuring a smoother, more efficient design process.




Features:


Automatic Resizing: Effortlessly fits text within its container.


Adjustable Scaling: Choose whether the plugin should only reduce text size or also increase it.




Use Cases:


Media Localization: Automatically adjust text size for translations.


Poster Design: Ensure all text fits beautifully within design elements.


Social Media Graphics: Create visually appealing graphics with perfectly sized text.




AutoFit Text simplifies your design workflow, allowing you to focus on creativity. We welcome any feedback at michael@apployal.co to continuously improve this plugin.
plugins.tagline: Automatically resize text to fit its container

plugins.name: Folder Structure
plugins.description:
🌟 Figma File Organizer Plugin


The Figma File Organizer Plugin is a powerful tool designed to streamline your design workflow by allowing you to organize your Figma files with ease. With this plugin, you can create folders and subfolders, helping you keep your design assets structured and accessible.


Configuration


- Create a figma personal access token (it is recommended to create a token with no expiration period, all the other settings will be left on default) and save it for later

  - While making sure you are signed into your figma account in the web browser, open https://www.figma.com/api/user/state in a new browser tab

  - In the downloaded JSON file, search for "personal_drafts_folder_id" and save the value associated to this key (this is your drafts folder id)

  - Open the plugin and go to the Configuration tab

  - Insert in the forms the figma personal access token and the drafts folder id that you saved above and press the Save config button


❗ Features


1. Folder and Subfolder Creation


Easily create folders and subfolders to categorize and group your Figma files. The plugin provides an intuitive interface for creating folders directly in the plugin interface.


2. Move Functionality


Effortlessly move files between folders using a simple drag-and-drop interface. This intuitive feature allows you to rearrange your files and folders seamlessly.


3. Rename and Delete


Customize folder names to suit your project's needs. The plugin also supports the deletion of folders, providing flexibility in managing your design assets. 


🙌 How to Use


  • Accessing the Plugin:

  - Open a Figma file.

  - Navigate to the Plugins menu.

  - Select "Folder structure" from the list of installed plugins.

  - Use the folder structure functionality from the Folder Viewer tab


  • Creating Folders:

  - Click the "New Folder" button or press CTRL+Ins.

  - Name your folder and press "Enter."


  • Managing Folders:

  - Drag files onto folders to organize them.

  - Press F2 with a folder selected to rename it

  - Delete the selected folders by clicking the Delete button or pressing the Del key


  • Drag-and-Drop:

  - Drag files between parent and child folders for quick organization.


  • Copy-Paste files and folders:

- Select the files and folders that you want to copy and press CTRL+C or use the left menu buttons

- Go in the destination folder and press CTRL+V or the left menu buttons


🛑 Limitations and Restrictions


Due to the way the Figma plugins work, there are some limitations:


- Files can not be modified (Created, Deleted, Renamed) from this plugin, only organized under folders

- You have to first access a file, then open the plugin to be able to view the folder structure

- When opening files, they are opened in a new browser tab

- ⛔ Be careful when clearing cookies and local browser storage as you will lose your folder structure

- Files can not be moved outside the Drafts folder

- Currently the plugin allows only Drafts management



The Figma File Structure Plugin is compatible with the latest versions of Figma and is designed to enhance your design workflow by providing a seamless file organization experience.


🚀 Try it now and bring order to your Figma design files!
plugins.tagline: Easily organize your figma files in folders and subfolders

plugins.name: FigTodo
plugins.description:
i have developed a plugin that makes task management in Figma easy. With this plugin, you can:


•Create multi-line tasks

•Create subtasks for each task

•Complete tasks

•Count the number of tasks

•Support dark mode

•Use in Figjam

•Set assignees

•Display anchor links

•Set deadlines


This plugin allows you to manage data for each Figma file, enabling efficient task management for different projects.


Upcoming Features


In future updates, the following features will be added:


•Sorting tasks

•Creating subtasks

•Setting tags


How to Use


1.Install the plugin in Figma.

2.To create a task, enter text in the task list and press Enter.

3.To set an assignee, click the assignee field of the task and select from the list.

4.To set a deadline, click the calendar icon and select a date.

5.To add an anchor link, click the link icon and enter the URL.


This plugin leverages Figma’s intuitive interface, making it a powerful tool for visually managing tasks across the team. It is also available in Figjam, making it useful for brainstorming and ideation sessions.
plugins.tagline: Easily manage tasks in Figma

plugins.name: Everything Toolbox
plugins.description:
Ok, well not everything. Currently the everything toolbox does four things


https://www.jpdesign.info/everything-toolbox


Quick Actions

Make selecting layers a lot quicker. Select more similar layers, less layers, layers within layers...


Text Merge

Setup lists of data and easily merge it into your document, either by layer name or by selecting your text. 


Default text

Set a default style for all of your new text boxes. Reduces the time spent messing with styles. 


To use there must be a style called _default which will be your default text style and the plug-in must be running!


Frame/Art-board manager

Add your own custom sized frames to Figma, create your standard layouts without having to use components 


Expose Properties

Surface children components’ properties when nested in parent components. Only supports Text & Layer properties right now.


Update - This feature has recently become a little redundant. Figma has released this feature natively. I'll keep this feature in for now, but you can consider this deprecated


If this has saved you some time, please consider supporting me buymeacoffee.com/?via=JPDesign


How to use

Text merge

First things first, you need to load your lists. We have some default ones for you here (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1zUKLsdsPHdoY9EhydyBKMDDECUTIyMOMSF-bnJ0WAPA/edit?usp=sharing), but to add your own go to ‘Edit lists’, copy it out of the text area (don’t try to edit it in that little box) and paste it into Google sheets

Make any edits you want and paste it back in, hit save and you’re done


There are two ways to merge your lists:


Naming layers, the first way is to name your layers to be the same as your list titles. Then just select a bunch of stuff and press merge. 


Alternatively if you just want to merge a specific list to a bunch of text boxes, you can just select the text boxes, select the list and it will merge for you. This will find all the text in the area you selected, so if you want to be precise make sure you select the right layers.


Exposed Properties

To simply expose a property, go to the component that has another instance of a component inside, select the instance (It can’t be an instance in an instance, but you can expose the property in that instance and then expose it further up, like a chain of props!)


That’s it, you can now use the exposed prop. The Everything Toolbox needs to be running when you change the prop.


When a property is exposed it will create a hidden group called _matadata, this is required to link the property. If you delete this the property will no longer be linked.
plugins.tagline: Figma Text management

plugins.name: TokensBrücke
plugins.description:
TokensBrücke is a Figma plugin that simplifies the process of converting Figma variables into design-tokens JSON. The plugin generates JSON files compatible with the latest Design Tokens specification.


🚀 Features:

  1. Color Modes: Choose from different color modes like HEX, RGBA, HSLA, and more for flexible color representation.
  2. Styles Support: Include typography, grids, shadows, and blur effects into the design tokens JSON, enhancing design element organization.

plugins.name: Confetti Pro
plugins.description:
Effortlessly generate confetti-like designs by duplicating any elements on the screen. It works by creating multiple copies of selected Node(s) and distributing them along the X and Y axes in both directions, relative to the original Node.


Key Features:

  • Effortless Duplication: Select your desired Node(s), activate Confetti Pro, and watch as it swiftly duplicates and arranges them for you.
  • Bidirectional Spread: Confetti Pro ensures copies are distributed both horizontally and vertically, giving you balanced results every time.
  • Full Control: You have full control over the number of copies, spread and rotation.
  • Live Preview: All changes are reflected in live design giving you the option to adjust and see how it work without closing the plugin. (Press cancel to delete and close if you don't like the design)


Optimal Placement: For the best results, position your elements closer to the center of the frame to achieve an even spread of the duplicates.


How to Use:

  1. Select the Node(s) you want to duplicate.
  2. Launch Confetti Pro from the Plugins menu.
  3. Adjust the settings to tailor the spread to your specific needs.
  4. When you are done, Click 'Apply' to save and close.
  5. If you don't like the output, Click 'Cancel' to revert and close.


This is my 1st plugin, Let me know your thoughts and feedback on this to make it better

plugins.name: Graph Visualiser
plugins.description:
Visualise any math functions by rendering their graphs right on Figma canvas!

Turn any mathematical expressions and functions into editable bezier curves in seconds. Simply enter the function you want to visualise (e.g. sin(x+1)*cos(x)^2), press Insert, and enjoy the rendered graph right in your Figma file canvas.


This is an open-source project, which means that you can contribute to its development by reviewing my spaghetti code or simply supporting it by giving it a star on GitHub.


I’m actively looking for feedback, so if something goes wrong or you want to request a feature, don’t hesitate to write a letter to my email address which you can find in the details section.

plugins.name: UX 라이팅 봇 (UX Writing Bot)
plugins.description:
UX Writing Bot

  • An AI bot that refines sentences to spark UXwriting inspiration.


[Features]

  • Spell checking
  • Cleaning up unnecessary adverbs and redundant expressions
  • Replacing words based on context
  • Correcting double passives
  • Making sentences more friendly with the use of 'Haeyo' style

🔧 We plan to add a feature to suggest sentences based on tones and intentions.


[How to Use]

  1. Select or enter the sentence you want to change.
  2. Click the '바꿔보기' button.
  3. Check the transformed sentence to get inspiration for UX writing.


[Others]

⚠️ The UX Writing Bot only supports Korean.

💁 If you have more to share, please refer here.


UX 라이팅 봇

  • 문장을 정돈해 UX라이팅에 영감을 주는 AI봇이에요


[기능]

  • 맞춤법 교정
  • 불필요한 부사, 중복 표현 정리
  • 맥락을 파악해 단어 교체
  • 이중피동 교정
  • '해요체'를 통해 친근하게 문장 교정

🔧 추후 다양한 어조와 의도에 따른 문장 제안 기능을 추가할 예정이에요


[사용 방법]

  1. 변경하고자 하는 문장을 선택하거나 입력해 주세요
  2. '바꿔보기' 버튼을 눌러 주세요
  3. 변환된 문장을 확인해 UX 라이팅 영감을 얻어 보세요


[기타]

⚠️ UX 라이팅 봇은 한국어만 지원해요

💁 더 나누고 싶은 이야기가 있다면 이쪽을 참고해주세요

plugins.name: A Replacer
plugins.description:
You can replace the layer with a custom element, and the replaced layer will inherit the size attribute.


你可以用自定义的元素替图层，被替换的图层会继承尺寸属性。


Different with the official 'Paste to replace' :


  • To replace A with B, 'Paste to replace' replaces the size of B together. Using A Replacer inherits size attributes from A to B.


  • 'Paste to replace' Ctr/CMD + C If the properties of the replacement source are changed, Ctr/CMD + V will replace the original element. A Replacer Always uses the current status of the replacement source for replacement.


Usage:


  • Select an element and add it to the replace source list
  • Select the element to be replaced, and then click the element in the "replacement source" list.
  • You can add multiple required replacement elements in the replacement source list in advance
  • The "replacement source" of each document is private
  • You can replace other elements with instances of the component by adding the component to the "replacement source". If you need to add a team component, please add the instance of the component to the document and add the instance as the "replacement source"


与官方 "Paste to replace"的区别：


  • 将A替换为B时，使用’ Paste to replace‘会将B的尺寸一起替换过去。使用 A Replacer 会将A的尺寸属性继承给B。


  • ’ Paste to replace‘ Ctr/CMD + C 复制了替换源后如果替换源的属性进行过更改，Ctr/CMD + V 替换的还是原本的元素。A Replacer 替换时始终使用替换源当前状态进行替换。


使用方式：

  • 选择一个元素，然后将其添加到“替换源”列表
  • 选择需要被替换的元素，然后点击“替换源”列表中的元素。
  • 可以在“替换源”列表中预先添加多个需要的替换元素
  • 每个文档的“替换源”都是私有的
  • 你可以通过将组件添加到“替换源”来将其他元素替换为该组件的实例，如果需要添加团队组件，请将组件的实例添加到文档后将该实例添加为“替换源”

accepted.name: Xing Zhuo
accepted.description: https://www.buymeacoffee.com/xingzhuo

plugins.name: Pseudoloc
plugins.description:
Quickly pseudo localize text right within Figma and test how your UI will work when translated. 

Select a text node, frame or group to apply the formatting to all text nodes inside that selection. Single text nodes lets you preview the pseudo localized string formatting from the plugin, for other types of selections you will see a sample. 

Formating options  include:
- Pad strings to simulate string expansion
- Optional start and end makers
- Two formatting strategies 
    - accented:  Ȧȧƈƈḗḗƞŧḗḗḓ Ḗḗƞɠŀīīşħ
